overview: A 16mm film about how to make your own optical soundtrack, it is also a playful film about space exploration. As the film progresses, the nature of the soundtrack comes to speak for the way space exploration is part of a larger, systemic repetition of colonialism. The film is purposefully queer, handmade and anti-illusionist as a means of deconstructing established narrative conventions and audience expectations.
title: Black Hole Space Debt
